trans-unit.source: Step 10: Test the Solution
trans-unit.target: Step 10: Test the Solution

trans-unit.source: This section demonstrates how to test the solution by dropping a flat-file message to a folder on the FTP Server.
trans-unit.target: This section demonstrates how to test the solution by dropping a flat-file message to a folder on the FTP Server.

trans-unit.source: The one-way bridge consumes this message, processes it, and then writes the values into the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>InsuranceData</embeddedLabel> database in the on-premises SQL Server instance for Humongous Insurance.
trans-unit.target: The one-way bridge consumes this message, processes it, and then writes the values into the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>InsuranceData</embeddedLabel> database in the on-premises SQL Server instance for Humongous Insurance.

trans-unit.source: To send a message to the bridge
trans-unit.target: To send a message to the bridge

trans-unit.source: Locate the <embeddedLabel>SampleInsuranceClaim.txt</embeddedLabel> message under the location where you downloaded the <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel> sample.
trans-unit.target: Locate the <embeddedLabel>SampleInsuranceClaim.txt</embeddedLabel> message under the location where you downloaded the <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel> sample.

trans-unit.source: See the contents of the message, which resemble the following:
trans-unit.target: See the contents of the message, which resemble the following:

trans-unit.source: Notice the second element, <embeddedLabel>HI</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Notice the second element, <embeddedLabel>HI</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This is type of claim that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: This is type of claim that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: Also, notice that there is no claim description for this claim type in the message that is sent by Northwind.
trans-unit.target: Also, notice that there is no claim description for this claim type in the message that is sent by Northwind.

trans-unit.source: Copy the message to the <embeddedLabel>ReceiveFFMessage</embeddedLabel> folder on the FTP Server.
trans-unit.target: Copy the message to the <embeddedLabel>ReceiveFFMessage</embeddedLabel> folder on the FTP Server.

trans-unit.source: The bridge you configured as part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token> picks messages from this folder.
trans-unit.target: The bridge you configured as part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token> picks messages from this folder.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the message to disappear.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the message to disappear.

trans-unit.source: Now go to the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>InsuranceData</embeddedLabel> database and verify if the new values have been inserted.
trans-unit.target: Now go to the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>InsuranceData</embeddedLabel> database and verify if the new values have been inserted.

trans-unit.source: Notice that even though the input flat-file message did not have a claim description, the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table has the value “HealthInsurance” inserted for the <embeddedLabel>ClaimTypeDescription</embeddedLabel> column.
trans-unit.target: Notice that even though the input flat-file message did not have a claim description, the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table has the value “HealthInsurance” inserted for the <embeddedLabel>ClaimTypeDescription</embeddedLabel> column.

trans-unit.source: This value was included in the message by using the <token>ssSDSfull</token> lookup configured as part of the bridge and the transform.
trans-unit.target: This value was included in the message by using the <token>ssSDSfull</token> lookup configured as part of the bridge and the transform.

trans-unit.source: If you want to see how the lookup configuration looks up value from the <token>ssSDS</token> table, change the value in the <embeddedLabel>ClaimTypeDescription</embeddedLabel> in the <token>ssSDS</token> table and then drop another message to the FTP location.
trans-unit.target: If you want to see how the lookup configuration looks up value from the <token>ssSDS</token> table, change the value in the <embeddedLabel>ClaimTypeDescription</embeddedLabel> in the <token>ssSDS</token> table and then drop another message to the FTP location.

trans-unit.source: The next message that is inserted in the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table must have the new value you entered in the <token>ssSDS</token>.
trans-unit.target: The next message that is inserted in the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table must have the new value you entered in the <token>ssSDS</token>.

trans-unit.source: Because you configured the bridge to track message properties, you can also view the tracked data from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Because you configured the bridge to track message properties, you can also view the tracked data from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <token>tpm_portal</token>, and from the left pane, click <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <token>tpm_portal</token>, and from the left pane, click <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the right pane, under the <embeddedLabel>Messages</embeddedLabel> tab, see the different levels of tracking info.
trans-unit.target: In the right pane, under the <embeddedLabel>Messages</embeddedLabel> tab, see the different levels of tracking info.

trans-unit.source: Select a row, and from the bottom of the screen click <embeddedLabel>Details</embeddedLabel> to see more details about that event.
trans-unit.target: Select a row, and from the bottom of the screen click <embeddedLabel>Details</embeddedLabel> to see more details about that event.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following screenshot shows the detailed info about the Route activity.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following screenshot shows the detailed info about the Route activity.

trans-unit.source: Note that it shows the values for <embeddedLabel>ClaimType</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>ClaimTypeDescription</embeddedLabel> properties.
trans-unit.target: Note that it shows the values for <embeddedLabel>ClaimType</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>ClaimTypeDescription</embeddedLabel> properties.

trans-unit.source: That’s because you selected these properties to be tracked (see <link xlink:href="a8cffcf3-2815-4e19-84b5-5b75d8b3f0c4#BKMK_Tracking" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure Tracking</link>) when you configured tracking as part of the bridge configuration.
trans-unit.target: That’s because you selected these properties to be tracked (see <link xlink:href="a8cffcf3-2815-4e19-84b5-5b75d8b3f0c4#BKMK_Tracking" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure Tracking</link>) when you configured tracking as part of the bridge configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to track messages, see <link xlink:href="100d9ba7-0ebc-40bf-8b5f-92641c9639ba" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to track messages, see <link xlink:href="100d9ba7-0ebc-40bf-8b5f-92641c9639ba" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages</link>.
